course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Major Issues in the History of U.S.-China Relations
course.description: This course examines the historical origins and evolution of the complex relations between China and the United States from the early 19th century to the late 20th century. It explores some of the most important events and persistent issues in political, military, economic, and cultural relations between the two countries. It also introduces students to major competing interpretations by American and Chinese scholars.

reviews.author: kelisi
reviews.title: good
reviews.comment_content: Including all the aspects you want to know about US-China relations from late Qing to the present. Prof Chang is an expert on Korean War. If you are interested in Korean war and the cold war, you should enroll
reviews.comment_teaching: The most important thing: reading. You have to read a lot and take notes. Moreover, every student will do a presentation and write three short reviews about the reading materials. Lastly, a final paper about the topics in the class, not very long, 10 pages are okay.
reviews.comment_grading: good. But hard to get a grade above A
reviews.comment_workload: a little bit heavy with a huge amount of reading materials every week.
